title: 5 Ways To Reduce Stress During The Holiday Season
summary: The holidays can be a wonderful time to spend with friends and family if you don't take steps to reduce your stress. The best way to reduce stress is to plan ahead and have a plan for when or where you have to do things. Manage your time during the holiday season is to set aside a certain amount of time for each task that you need to accomplish, and then stay focused on that task until it is done. When we are grateful, we are happy with what we have, and we donâ€™t feel the need to have more to do.

If you know what you have to do and have a plan for when or where you have to do it, you will not have time to worry about it."),mdx("p",null,"In this season, there\u2019s a lot to do. There\u2019s shopping, cooking, decorating, cleaning, and parties to plan. The best way to reduce stress is to make a plan for when you will do all of these things. Write out your schedule and place the tasks you have to do on your schedule. This way, you will know when you have to do things, and if you have a busy schedule, you will know what you have to do each day and won\u2019t have time to worry about how you are going to get everything done because you already have a plan for it."),mdx("h2",null,"Manage your time"),mdx("p",null,`Another way to reduce stress during the holiday season is to manage your time. This means setting aside a certain amount of time for each task that you need to accomplish, and then staying focused on that task until it is done.
For example, if you want to bake cookies for the holidays, you might set a timer for 30 minutes. Once that timer goes off, you are done baking. You don\u2019t have to be a baking master to do this. It can apply to everything, including gift buying, decorating, entertaining, or whatever else you need to do.
We may have a lot to do during the holidays, but we have a set amount of time that we have to do it. So if you manage your time, you will know how much time you have to get each task done, and you will not have time to worry about how you are going to get everything done.`),mdx("h2",null,"Ask for help"),mdx("p",null,`Another way to reduce stress during the holiday season is to ask for help. When you ask for help, you are not only helping yourself, but you are also giving others a chance to help you.
And there are plenty of people around who would love to help you. From your family to your friends, to the people you work with, everyone wants to help and has a lot to offer.
If you are feeling stressed because you are trying to take on too much, ask for help. Tell the people in your life that you need their help. You don\u2019t have to do everything yourself, and there is no shame in letting people help you. This can lighten your load and give you time to focus on the things that matter most to you.`),mdx("h2",null,"Stay physically healthy"),mdx("p",null,`Another way to reduce stress during the holiday season is to stay physically healthy. This means getting enough sleep, eating healthy meals, and exercising regularly.
If you are tired and hungry, you are more likely to feel stressed. So try to get at least seven hours of sleep each night, eat healthy meals, and exercise regularly.
When you feel healthy, you are less likely to succumb to stress. You have more energy and are less susceptible to illness. You are also more able to focus on the tasks at hand, rather than being distracted by hunger, tiredness, or a need for health care.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t forget to be grateful"),mdx("p",null,`Another way to reduce stress during the holiday season is to be grateful. When we are grateful, we are appreciative of what we have, rather than focused on what we don\u2019t have. When we are grateful, we are happy with what we have, and we don\u2019t feel the need to have more.
When we are grateful, we are less likely to feel stressed. We have less of a need to have more and more to do. We are focused on what we already have and for what it is worth.
So when you are stressed out during the holidays, take a step back and be grateful for what you already have. Think about what you are doing to contribute to others\u2019 lives, and appreciate the roles that each person in your life plays.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"The holidays can be a wonderful time to spend with friends and family. They can also be a very stressful time if you don't take steps to reduce your stress during the holidays. That's why it's important to plan ahead, manage your time, ask for help, stay physically healthy, and remember to be grateful for what you have. These are five ways you can do so."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

It\u2019s ideal for individuals who want an alternative to litigation or other traditional dispute resolution processes. Unlike arbitration, mediation isn\u2019t binding, which means that if you choose to continue with litigation after mediation, you will not be precluded from doing so. And while it doesn\u2019t involve a third party making a decision on your case, as in quasi-negotiation, mediation is not a fiasco or popularity contest. Rather than having another person make the final call about what\u2019s fair, mediation gives each side the opportunity to advocate for themselves and their interests while listening respectfully to the other party\u2019s concerns as well. Read on to learn more about who can benefit from mediation"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Benefits of Owning a Cat

There is a general belief that having a cat as a pet will cut down on your social life and limit your ability to travel. While that may be true for some people, that generalization doesn\u2019t tell the whole story. Cats are fantastic pets, and if you choose the right breed, they can bring many benefits to your life. Cat ownership offers numerous positive benefits in many different areas of your life. These are just some of the reasons why you should own a cat!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Toilet Outside

var y=Object.defineProperty,c=Object.defineProperties;var m=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var i=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,h=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var r=(e,t,o)=>t in e?y(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,s=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))i.call(t,o)&&r(e,o,t[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(t))h.call(t,o)&&r(e,o,t[o]);return e},u=(e,t)=>c(e,m(t));var d=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var a in e)i.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(o[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var a of n(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&h.call(e,a)&&(o[a]=e[a]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var a=o,{components:e}=a,t=d(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,u(s(s({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Your dog might have been house-trained as a puppy, but that doesn\u2019t mean they won\u2019t have accidents as an adult. Maybe you\u2019ve just moved to a new home and your dog hasn\u2019t gotten used to the new smells yet, or maybe he has medical issues that are causing him to have accidents. Whatever the reason, if your dog is having accidents in the house it can be distressing for both of you. However, with time and patience you can help your dog learn again how to toilet outside.
There are various reasons why a dog may stop using the indoor toilet. It may be as simple as them not liking it because of its location or smell or because there\u2019s another person or animal living in the house now who they don\u2019t like seeing when they do their business.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Tips for Sticking to Your New Year's Resolutions

What you do with that opportunity is up to you. Maybe you resolve to eat healthier, exercise more or reduce stress and anxiety. Maybe you decide to learn a new skill, read more books, help others or travel more. Or maybe your resolution is to do something completely different \u2014 like learn a language, stop procrastinating or read the complete works of Shakespeare. The possibilities are endless, but sticking to those resolutions can be challenging. The key is establishing habits that will last all 365 days of the year and not just one crazy day in January. It takes small but deliberate changes in everyday life that add up over time and become second nature. Here are 10 easy tips for sticking to your New Year\u2019s resolutions:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation for Couples?

var u=Object.defineProperty,p=Object.defineProperties;var h=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var c=(e,i,o)=>i in e?u(e,i,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[i]=o,a=(e,i)=>{for(var o in i||(i={}))s.call(i,o)&&c(e,o,i[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(i))r.call(i,o)&&c(e,o,i[o]);return e},l=(e,i)=>p(e,h(i));var d=(e,i)=>{var o={};for(var t in e)s.call(e,t)&&i.indexOf(t)<0&&(o[t]=e[t]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var t of n(e))i.indexOf(t)<0&&r.call(e,t)&&(o[t]=e[t]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var t=o,{components:e}=t,i=d(t,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(a(a({},layoutProps),i),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Mediation has been practiced across cultures for thousands of years. It is a process that brings people together to resolve conflict and find mutually satisfying solutions. In mediation, an impartial third party assists the disputing parties in identifying the issues, exploring their own role in it and accessing their core needs to come up with a solution that works for all parties involved.
Mediation is a confidential process and there are many types of mediation depending on the nature of conflict. For example, dispute resolution could be focusing on specific issues such as environmental concerns or human resources issues; it could be between two parties such as divorce mediation or landlord-tenant mediation; it could be on a particular topic like civil rights mediation or criminal mediation; or it could be based on certain factors like age, gender, sexual orientation or physical ability. The following article explores the ways in which mediation can help you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

var p=Object.defineProperty,c=Object.defineProperties;var m=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var t=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var a=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var l=(e,n,o)=>n in e?p(e,n,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[n]=o,i=(e,n)=>{for(var o in n||(n={}))a.call(n,o)&&l(e,o,n[o]);if(t)for(var o of t(n))r.call(n,o)&&l(e,o,n[o]);return e},d=(e,n)=>c(e,m(n));var u=(e,n)=>{var o={};for(var s in e)a.call(e,s)&&n.indexOf(s)<0&&(o[s]=e[s]);if(e!=null&&t)for(var s of t(e))n.indexOf(s)<0&&r.call(e,s)&&(o[s]=e[s]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var s=o,{components:e}=s,n=u(s,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,d(i(i({},layoutProps),n),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a win-win proposition for businesses. It\u2019s an impartial and confidential process that helps individuals, businesses, and organizations reach mutually beneficial solutions to their conflicts. These solutions are usually in the form of agreements called \u201Cmediation agreements\u201D or \u201Ccollaborative mediation agreements.\u201D Mediation is not a one-time event but rather an ongoing process and collaboration between the disputants that involves multiple sessions.
Mediation can be used in all kinds of relationships where there is an opportunity to explore different ways of dealing with conflict and find win-win solutions without having to go to court or some other expensive third party adjudication. These include disputes between partners, shareholders, suppliers, customers, tenants, employees, suppliers and competitors; labor/management; landlord/tenant; divorcing spouses; members of nonprofit boards; roommates; feuding neighbours; business partners (and service providers); vendors (and clients); owners and real estate developers; executors and beneficiaries of trusts; owners and local governments etc.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How Mediation Can Help You Resolve Conflicts
From First Date to Soulmate: How to Know If You're on the Right Track

intro.compiledSource:
var m=Object.defineProperty,l=Object.defineProperties;var y=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(e,t,o)=>t in e?m(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,i=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))r.call(t,o)&&h(e,o,t[o]);if(a)for(var o of a(t))s.call(t,o)&&h(e,o,t[o]);return e},u=(e,t)=>l(e,y(t));var g=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var n in e)r.call(e,n)&&t.indexOf(n)<0&&(o[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var n of a(e))t.indexOf(n)<0&&s.call(e,n)&&(o[n]=e[n]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var n=o,{components:e}=n,t=g(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,u(i(i({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`There are so many first date horror stories out there \u2014 awkward silences, strange amateur- magician tricks, and cringe-worthy pick-up lines being just a few of them. But getting past these awkward initial stages and finding a potential partner who you can connect with on a deeper level is no mean feat. Figuring out if someone is your soulmate or simply the first step to becoming one isn\u2019t easy. Even though it can feel like we\u2019re constantly being bombarded with images of fairy tale love and meet-cute romances, dating in real life isn\u2019t always so straightforward. Unless you\u2019re living under a rock, you probably know that letting somebody into your private world isn\u2019t something to take lightly.
But how do you know if you\u2019re on the right track when it comes to dating? Whether you\u2019ve just met someone new and want to get to know them better without rushing things or have been seeing somebody for some time and are wondering if they could be The One, here are some signs that could indicate that this person may be more than just a casual partner\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
